page.title: 07LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {St.Peter's School.}Foundation Stone laid in 1850. School opened in 1851.133 girls in one room,165 mixed infants in second room. 1893, boys moved out, now girls school. 1904 the school was enlarged. Our new school was built in 1975,(old school-see annexe).{Sopwell Nunnery,}a chapel for monks and nuns, was knocked down by Henry V111.Sopwell House was built for Sir Richard Lee. Now all that is left is a ruin of flints and old bricks. The {Old Mill}at Cottonmill is 200 years old. Originally a flour mill, it now houses five companies, one of which is Apex Electrical. The original {Storage Barn,}a garage for the last 14 years,is a protected building with 500 year old beams from the original monastery.
